hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: An accountancy practice halyardhealth.com email Coming to your boss with a counteroffer from a competitor can also lead to a bump in pay, but it's risky. A less threatening route, says Ceniza-Levine, is to reach out to recruiters to see what salary you could command. Then you can say to your boss, "Recruiters are coming to me with offers that are 20% above where I am, but I like it here. Is there anything we can do?" Framing the situation as a shared problem reinforces that you're still loyal.
